intro: Acinodendron setosociliatum, commonly known as the hairy-ciliated acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or thickets. Its unique features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
